frameDefinitions: There is a gradable amount of light in a particular Location.
Two individuals, the Subordinate and the Superior have a relationship such that the Subordinate generally follows orders given by the Superior and has the best interests of the Superior in mind.
An individual or group, the Rebel, rejects the authority of the Current_leadership, and attempts to bring them out of power.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause_of_shine.
This frame contains nouns denoting a rank or level within an established hierarchy.
frameExamples: The small print was bearly readable by the light of the very <t>dim</t> torch.
The archduke and several of his <t><fex name='Subordinate'>henchmen</fex></t> got out of the carriage, looking around nervously.
In 1641 there was a Catholic <t>rebellion</t> against the Protestants of Ulster, and English authority over the island was shaken.
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
listRoleDefinitions: The place whose amout of light is being described.  The <fen>Location</fen> can also be a location in time, as seen in the second example below:
The entity from which the light eminates.
The individual in charge of the <fen>Subordinate</fen>.
The individual under the command of the <fen>Superior</fen>.
The individual or group within a society that attempts to overturn the <fen>Current_leadership</fen>, and possibly also the <fen>Current_order</fen> of governance.
The people currently in power, whom the <fen>Rebel</fen>s attempt to overthrow.
The currently-existing system of authority or government.
The time when the rebellion takes place.
The location of the rebellion.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
The percept which is perceived at a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The location of the phenomenon.
The <fen>Light</fen> which is emitted.  In this frame, it is usually incorporated in verbs and adjectives, and is the denotation of many of the nouns.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Figure</fen> is observed against the <fen>Ground</fen> location due to <fen>Light</fen> shining on it.
The spatial setting in which the <fen>Figure</fen> shows up against a <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The Rank itself, usually denoted by the noun.
An entity which holds a particular <fen>Rank</fen>.
listRoleExamples: She hid from the man in a dark <fex>corner</fex>.
A dim <fex>lamp</fex> swung over the entrance to the castle.
In 1641 there was a <fex>Catholic</fex> rebellion against the Protestants of Ulster, and English authority over the island was shaken.
It was the first time that a man of such high rank had been put to death for rebellion <fex>against the king</fex>.
At the time they were in rebellion <fex>against the Catholic government</fex>.
It seems probably that rebellion <fex>in East Anglia</fex> was as rigorously suppressed as in Kent.
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
Hot coals glowed <fex>behind the fire grate</fex>.
<fex>In the morning</fex> the grass glistened with dew
<fex>Outside</fex> something was shimmering on the shore.
